info.title: simcore-service-catalog
info.description: Manages and maintains a catalog of all published components (e.g. macro-algorithms, scripts, etc)

parameters.description: if passed, and that user has custom resources, they will be merged with default resources and returned.

schema.title: User Id
schema.description: if passed, and that user has custom resources, they will be merged with default resources and returned.

parameters.name: user_id

schema.title: Response Get Service Resources V0 Services  Service Key   Service Version  Resources Get

parameters.description: if True only the version specs will be retrieved, if False the latest version will be used instead

schema.title: Strict
schema.description: if True only the version specs will be retrieved, if False the latest version will be used instead

parameters.name: strict

get.description: Returns a list of service ports starting with inputs and followed by outputs

schema.title: Response List Service Ports V0 Services  Service Key   Service Version  Ports Get

get.description: Returns access rights information for provided service and product

schema.title: Response List Services V0 Services Get

released.title: Released
released.description: Maps every route's path tag with a released version

Propagation.description: A propagation mode with the value `[r]private`, `[r]shared`, or `[r]slave`.

File.title: File
File.description:
File represents a specific target that is backed by a file.


> **Note**: `Configs.File` and `Configs.Runtime` are mutually exclusive

Runtime.title: Runtime
Runtime.description:
Runtime represents a target that is not mounted into the container but is used by the task


> **Note**: `Configs.File` and `Configs.Runtime` are mutually > exclusive

ConfigID.title: Configid
ConfigID.description:
ConfigID represents the ID of the specific config that we're
referencing.

ConfigName.title: Configname
ConfigName.description:
ConfigName is the name of the config that this references,
but this is just provided for lookup/display purposes. The
config in the reference will be identified by its ID.

Image.title: Image
Image.description: The image name to use for the container

Command.title: Command
Command.description: The command to be run in the image.

Hostname.title: Hostname
Hostname.description:
The hostname to use for the container, as a valid
[RFC 1123](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1123) hostname.

Env.title: Env
Env.description: A list of environment variables in the form `VAR=value`.

Dir.title: Dir
Dir.description: The working directory for commands to run in.

Groups.title: Groups
Groups.description: A list of additional groups that the container process will run as.

TTY.title: Tty
TTY.description: Whether a pseudo-TTY should be allocated.

ReadOnly.title: Readonly
ReadOnly.description: Mount the container's root filesystem as read only.

Mounts.title: Mounts
Mounts.description:
Specification for mounts to be added to containers created as part
of the service.

StopGracePeriod.title: Stopgraceperiod
StopGracePeriod.description:
Amount of time to wait for the container to terminate before
forcefully killing it.

Hosts.title: Hosts
Hosts.description:
A list of hostname/IP mappings to add to the container's `hosts`
file. The format of extra hosts is specified in the
[hosts(5)](http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man5/hosts.5.html)
man page:

    IP_address canonical_hostname [aliases...]

DNSConfig.title: Dnsconfig
DNSConfig.description:
Specification for DNS related configurations in resolver configuration
file (`resolv.conf`).

Secrets.title: Secrets
Secrets.description:
Secrets contains references to zero or more secrets that will be
exposed to the service.

Configs.title: Configs
Configs.description:
Configs contains references to zero or more configs that will be
exposed to the service.

Isolation.description:
Isolation technology of the containers running the service.
(Windows only)

Init.title: Init
Init.description:
Run an init inside the container that forwards signals and reaps
processes. This field is omitted if empty, and the default (as
configured on the daemon) is used.

Sysctls.title: Sysctls
Sysctls.description:
Set kernel namedspaced parameters (sysctls) in the container.
The Sysctls option on services accepts the same sysctls as the
are supported on containers. Note that while the same sysctls are
supported, no guarantees or checks are made about their
suitability for a clustered environment, and it's up to the user
to determine whether a given sysctl will work properly in a
Service.

CapabilityAdd.title: Capabilityadd
CapabilityAdd.description:
A list of kernel capabilities to add to the default set
for the container.

CapabilityDrop.title: Capabilitydrop
CapabilityDrop.description:
A list of kernel capabilities to drop from the default set
for the container.

Ulimits.title: Ulimits
Ulimits.description: A list of resource limits to set in the container. For example: `{"Name": "nofile", "Soft": 1024, "Hard": 2048}`"

ContainerSpec.title: ContainerSpec
ContainerSpec.description:
Container spec for the service.


> **Note**: ContainerSpec, NetworkAttachmentSpec, and PluginSpec are > mutually exclusive. PluginSpec is only used when the Runtime field > is set to `plugin`. NetworkAttachmentSpec is used when the Runtime > field is set to `attachment`.

Config.title: Config
Config.description:
Load credential spec from a Swarm Config with the given ID. The specified config must also be present in the Configs field with the Runtime property set.


> **Note**: `CredentialSpec.File`, `CredentialSpec.Registry`, > and `CredentialSpec.Config` are mutually exclusive.

File.title: File
File.description:
Load credential spec from this file. The file is read by the daemon, and must be present in the `CredentialSpecs` subdirectory in the docker data directory, which defaults to `C:\ProgramData\Docker\` on Windows. For example, specifying `spec.json` loads `C:\ProgramData\Docker\CredentialSpecs\spec.json`.


> **Note**: `CredentialSpec.File`, `CredentialSpec.Registry`, > and `CredentialSpec.Config` are mutually exclusive.

Registry.title: Registry
Registry.description:
Load credential spec from this value in the Windows registry. The specified registry value must be located in: `HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Virtualization\Containers\CredentialSpecs`


> **Note**: `CredentialSpec.File`, `CredentialSpec.Registry`, > and `CredentialSpec.Config` are mutually exclusive.

CredentialSpec.title: CredentialSpec
CredentialSpec.description: CredentialSpec for managed service account (Windows only)

Nameservers.title: Nameservers
Nameservers.description: The IP addresses of the name servers.

Search.title: Search
Search.description: A search list for host-name lookup.

Options.title: Options
Options.description:
A list of internal resolver variables to be modified (e.g.,
`debug`, `ndots:3`, etc.).

DNSConfig.title: DNSConfig
DNSConfig.description:
Specification for DNS related configurations in resolver configuration
file (`resolv.conf`).

Name.title: Name
Name.description: Name of the driver to use to create the volume.

Options.title: Options
Options.description: key/value map of driver specific options.

PublishedPort.title: Publishedport
PublishedPort.description: The port on the swarm hosts.

PublishMode.description:
The mode in which port is published.


- "ingress" makes the target port accessible on every node, regardless of whether there is a task for the service running on that node or not. - "host" bypasses the routing mesh and publish the port directly on the swarm node where that service is running.

Mode.description: The mode of resolution to use for internal load balancing between tasks.

Ports.title: Ports
Ports.description:
List of exposed ports that this service is accessible on from the
outside. Ports can only be provided if `vip` resolution mode is used.

EndpointSpec.title: EndpointSpec
EndpointSpec.description: Properties that can be configured to access and load balance a service.

FailureAction.title: FailureAction
FailureAction.description:
Action to take if an updated task fails to run, or stops running
during the update.

FailureAction1.title: FailureAction1
FailureAction1.description:
Action to take if an rolled back task fails to run, or stops
running during the rollback.

Name.title: Name
Name.description: Name represents the final filename in the filesystem.

Mode.title: Mode
Mode.description: Mode represents the FileMode of the file.

File.title: File
File.description: File represents a specific target that is backed by a file.

Name.title: Name
Name.description: Name represents the final filename in the filesystem.

Mode.title: Mode
Mode.description: Mode represents the FileMode of the file.

File1.title: File1
File1.description:
File represents a specific target that is backed by a file.


> **Note**: `Configs.File` and `Configs.Runtime` are mutually exclusive

GenericResources.title: GenericResources
GenericResources.description:
User-defined resources can be either Integer resources (e.g, `SSD=3`) or
String resources (e.g, `GPU=UUID1`).

Test.title: Test
Test.description:
The test to perform. Possible values are:

- `[]` inherit healthcheck from image or parent image
- `["NONE"]` disable healthcheck
- `["CMD", args...]` exec arguments directly
- `["CMD-SHELL", command]` run command with system's default shell

Interval.title: Interval
Interval.description:
The time to wait between checks in nanoseconds. It should be 0 or at
least 1000000 (1 ms). 0 means inherit.

Timeout.title: Timeout
Timeout.description:
The time to wait before considering the check to have hung. It should
be 0 or at least 1000000 (1 ms). 0 means inherit.

Retries.title: Retries
Retries.description:
The number of consecutive failures needed to consider a container as
unhealthy. 0 means inherit.

StartPeriod.title: Startperiod
StartPeriod.description:
Start period for the container to initialize before starting
health-retries countdown in nanoseconds. It should be 0 or at least
1000000 (1 ms). 0 means inherit.

HealthConfig.title: HealthConfig
HealthConfig.description: A test to perform to check that the container is healthy.

image.title: Image
image.description: Used by the frontend to provide a context for the users.Services with a docker-compose spec will have multiple entries.Using the `image:version` instead of the docker-compose spec is more helpful for the end user.

boot_modes.description: describe how a service shall be booted, using CPU, MPI, openMP or GPU

Isolation.title: Isolation
Isolation.description: Isolation technology of the container. (Windows only)

Pids.title: Pids
Pids.description: Limits the maximum number of PIDs in the container. Set `0` for unlimited.

Limit.title: Limit
Limit.description: An object describing a limit on resources which can be requested by a task.

LogDriver1.title: LogDriver1
LogDriver1.description:
Specifies the log driver to use for tasks created from this spec. If
not present, the default one for the swarm will be used, finally
falling back to the engine default if not specified.

ReplicatedJob.title: Replicatedjob
ReplicatedJob.description:
The mode used for services with a finite number of tasks that run
to a completed state.

GlobalJob.title: Globaljob
GlobalJob.description:
The mode used for services which run a task to the completed state
on each valid node.

Mode1.title: Mode1
Mode1.description: The mode of resolution to use for internal load balancing between tasks.

Source.title: Source
Source.description: Mount source (e.g. a volume name, a host path).

Type.description:
The mount type. Available types:

- `bind` Mounts a file or directory from the host into the container. Must exist prior to creating the container.
- `volume` Creates a volume with the given name and options (or uses a pre-existing volume with the same name and options). These are **not** removed when the container is removed.
- `tmpfs` Create a tmpfs with the given options. The mount source cannot be specified for tmpfs.
- `npipe` Mounts a named pipe from the host into the container. Must exist prior to creating the container.

ReadOnly.title: Readonly
ReadOnly.description: Whether the mount should be read-only.

Consistency.title: Consistency
Consistency.description: The consistency requirement for the mount: `default`, `consistent`, `cached`, or `delegated`.

Target.title: Target
Target.description: The target network for attachment. Must be a network name or ID.

Aliases.title: Aliases
Aliases.description: Discoverable alternate names for the service on this network.

DriverOpts.title: Driveropts
DriverOpts.description: Driver attachment options for the network target.

NetworkAttachmentConfig.title: NetworkAttachmentConfig
NetworkAttachmentConfig.description: Specifies how a service should be attached to a particular network.

ContainerID.title: Containerid
ContainerID.description: ID of the container represented by this task

NetworkAttachmentSpec.title: NetworkAttachmentSpec
NetworkAttachmentSpec.description:
Read-only spec type for non-swarm containers attached to swarm overlay networks.


> **Note**: ContainerSpec, NetworkAttachmentSpec, and PluginSpec are > mutually exclusive. PluginSpec is only used when the Runtime field > is set to `plugin`. NetworkAttachmentSpec is used when the Runtime > field is set to `attachment`.

Order.title: Order
Order.description:
The order of operations when rolling out an updated task. Either
the old task is shut down before the new task is started, or the
new task is started before the old task is shut down.

Constraints.title: Constraints
Constraints.description:
An array of constraint expressions to limit the set of nodes where
a task can be scheduled. Constraint expressions can either use a
_match_ (`==`) or _exclude_ (`!=`) rule. Multiple constraints find
nodes that satisfy every expression (AND match). Constraints can
match node or Docker Engine labels as follows:

node attribute       | matches                        | example
---------------------|--------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------
`node.id`            | Node ID                        | `node.id==2ivku8v2gvtg4`
`node.hostname`      | Node hostname                  | `node.hostname!=node-2`
`node.role`          | Node role (`manager`/`worker`) | `node.role==manager`
`node.platform.os`   | Node operating system          | `node.platform.os==windows`
`node.platform.arch` | Node architecture              | `node.platform.arch==x86_64`
`node.labels`        | User-defined node labels       | `node.labels.security==high`
`engine.labels`      | Docker Engine's labels         | `engine.labels.operatingsystem==ubuntu-14.04`

`engine.labels` apply to Docker Engine labels like operating system,
drivers, etc. Swarm administrators add `node.labels` for operational
purposes by using the [`node update endpoint`](#operation/NodeUpdate).

Preferences.title: Preferences
Preferences.description:
Preferences provide a way to make the scheduler aware of factors
such as topology. They are provided in order from highest to
lowest precedence.

MaxReplicas.title: Maxreplicas
MaxReplicas.description:
Maximum number of replicas for per node (default value is 0, which
is unlimited)

Platforms.title: Platforms
Platforms.description:
Platforms stores all the platforms that the service's image can
run on. This field is used in the platform filter for scheduling.
If empty, then the platform filter is off, meaning there are no
scheduling restrictions.

Architecture.title: Architecture
Architecture.description:
Architecture represents the hardware architecture (for example,
`x86_64`).

OS.title: Os
OS.description: OS represents the Operating System (for example, `linux` or `windows`).

PluginPrivilege.title: PluginPrivilege
PluginPrivilege.description:
Describes a permission the user has to accept upon installing
the plugin.

Name.title: Name
Name.description: The name or 'alias' to use for the plugin.

Remote.title: Remote
Remote.description: The plugin image reference to use.

PluginSpec.title: PluginSpec
PluginSpec.description:
Plugin spec for the service. *(Experimental release only.)*


> **Note**: ContainerSpec, NetworkAttachmentSpec, and PluginSpec are > mutually exclusive. PluginSpec is only used when the Runtime field > is set to `plugin`. NetworkAttachmentSpec is used when the Runtime > field is set to `attachment`.

CredentialSpec.title: Credentialspec
CredentialSpec.description: CredentialSpec for managed service account (Windows only)

Propagation.title: Propagation
Propagation.description: A propagation mode with the value `[r]private`, `[r]shared`, or `[r]slave`.

PublishMode.title: PublishMode
PublishMode.description:
The mode in which port is published.


- "ingress" makes the target port accessible on every node, regardless of whether there is a task for the service running on that node or not. - "host" bypasses the routing mesh and publish the port directly on the swarm node where that service is running.

MaxConcurrent.title: Maxconcurrent
MaxConcurrent.description: The maximum number of replicas to run simultaneously.

TotalCompletions.title: Totalcompletions
TotalCompletions.description:
The total number of replicas desired to reach the Completed
state. If unset, will default to the value of `MaxConcurrent`

ReplicatedJob.title: ReplicatedJob
ReplicatedJob.description:
The mode used for services with a finite number of tasks that run
to a completed state.

ResourceObject.title: ResourceObject
ResourceObject.description:
An object describing the resources which can be advertised by a node and
requested by a task.

Resources1.title: Resources1
Resources1.description:
Resource requirements which apply to each individual container created
as part of the service.

MaxAttempts.title: Maxattempts
MaxAttempts.description:
Maximum attempts to restart a given container before giving up
(default value is 0, which is ignored).

Window.title: Window
Window.description:
Windows is the time window used to evaluate the restart policy
(default value is 0, which is unbounded).

RestartPolicy1.title: RestartPolicy1
RestartPolicy1.description:
Specification for the restart policy which applies to containers
created as part of this service.

Parallelism.title: Parallelism
Parallelism.description:
Maximum number of tasks to be rolled back in one iteration (0 means
unlimited parallelism).

Delay.title: Delay
Delay.description: Amount of time between rollback iterations, in nanoseconds.

FailureAction.description:
Action to take if an rolled back task fails to run, or stops
running during the rollback.

Monitor.title: Monitor
Monitor.description:
Amount of time to monitor each rolled back task for failures, in
nanoseconds.

MaxFailureRatio.title: Maxfailureratio
MaxFailureRatio.description:
The fraction of tasks that may fail during a rollback before the
failure action is invoked, specified as a floating point number
between 0 and 1.

Order.description:
The order of operations when rolling back a task. Either the old
task is shut down before the new task is started, or the new task
is started before the old task is shut down.

RollbackConfig.title: RollbackConfig
RollbackConfig.description: Specification for the rollback strategy of the service.

File.title: File
File.description: File represents a specific target that is backed by a file.

SecretID.title: Secretid
SecretID.description:
SecretID represents the ID of the specific secret that we're
referencing.

SecretName.title: Secretname
SecretName.description:
SecretName is the name of the secret that this references,
but this is just provided for lookup/display purposes. The
secret in the reference will be identified by its ID.

name.title: Name
name.description: Display name: short, human readable name for the node

description.title: Description
description.description: human readable description of the purpose of the node

deprecated.title: Deprecated
deprecated.description: If filled with a date, then the service is to be deprecated at that date (e.g. cannot start anymore)

accessRights.title: Accessrights
accessRights.description: service access rights per group id

key.title: Key
key.description: distinctive name for the node based on the docker registry path

version_display.title: Version Display
version_display.description: A user-friendly or marketing name for the release. This can be used to reference the release in a more readable and recognizable format, such as 'Matterhorn Release,' 'Spring Update,' or 'Holiday Edition.' This name is not used for version comparison but is useful for communication and documentation purposes.

release_date.title: Release Date
release_date.description: A timestamp when the specific version of the service was released. This field helps in tracking the timeline of releases and understanding the sequence of updates. A timestamp string should be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD[T]HH:MM[:SS[.ffffff]][Z or [±]HH[:]MM]

integration-version.title: Integration-Version
integration-version.description: This version is used to maintain backward compatibility when there are changes in the way a service is integrated into the framework

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: email to correspond to the authors about the node

inputs.title: Inputs
inputs.description: definition of the inputs of this node

outputs.title: Outputs
outputs.description: definition of the outputs of this node

boot-options.title: Boot-Options
boot-options.description: Service defined boot options. These get injected in the service as env variables.

min-visible-inputs.title: Min-Visible-Inputs
min-visible-inputs.description: The number of 'data type inputs' displayed by default in the UI. When None all 'data type inputs' are displayed.

progress_regexp.title: Progress Regexp
progress_regexp.description: regexp pattern for detecting computational service's progress

ServiceGet.title: ServiceGet
ServiceGet.description:
Service metadata at publication time

- read-only (can only be changed overwriting the image labels in the registry)
- base metaddata
- injected in the image labels

NOTE: This model is serialized in .osparc/metadata.yml and in the labels of the docker image

execute_access.title: Execute Access
execute_access.description: defines whether the group can execute the service

write_access.title: Write Access
write_access.description: defines whether the group can modify the service

displayOrder.title: Displayorder
displayOrder.description: DEPRECATED: new display order is taken from the item position. This will be removed.

type.title: Type
type.description: data type expected on this input glob matching for data type is allowed

contentSchema.title: Contentschema
contentSchema.description: jsonschema of this input/output. Required when type='ref_contentSchema'

fileToKeyMap.title: Filetokeymap
fileToKeyMap.description: Place the data associated with the named keys in files

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: Units, when it refers to a physical quantity

widget.title: Widget
widget.description: custom widget to use instead of the default one determined from the data-type

ServiceInput.title: ServiceInput
ServiceInput.description: Metadata on a service input port

displayOrder.title: Displayorder
displayOrder.description: DEPRECATED: new display order is taken from the item position. This will be removed.

type.title: Type
type.description: data type expected on this input glob matching for data type is allowed

contentSchema.title: Contentschema
contentSchema.description: jsonschema of this input/output. Required when type='ref_contentSchema'

fileToKeyMap.title: Filetokeymap
fileToKeyMap.description: Place the data associated with the named keys in files

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: Units, when it refers to a physical quantity

widget.title: Widget
widget.description: custom widget to use instead of the default one determined from the data-type

content_schema.title: Content Schema
content_schema.description: jsonschema for the port's value. SEE https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/

UpdateConfig.title: Updateconfig
UpdateConfig.description: Specification for the update strategy of the service.

RollbackConfig.title: Rollbackconfig
RollbackConfig.description: Specification for the rollback strategy of the service.

Networks.title: Networks
Networks.description: Specifies which networks the service should attach to.

ServiceSpec.title: ServiceSpec
ServiceSpec.description: User modifiable configuration for a service.

sidecar.title: Sidecar
sidecar.description: schedule-time specifications for the service sidecar (follows Docker Service creation API, see https://docs.docker.com/engine/api/v1.25/#operation/ServiceCreate)

service.title: Service
service.description: schedule-time specifications specifications for the service (follows Docker Service creation API (specifically only the Resources part), see https://docs.docker.com/engine/api/v1.41/#tag/Service/operation/ServiceCreate

accessRights.title: Accessrights
accessRights.description: service access rights per group id

deprecated.title: Deprecated
deprecated.description: If filled with a date, then the service is to be deprecated at that date (e.g. cannot start anymore)

example.name: My Human Readable Service Name
example.description: An interesting service that does something

PluginSpec.title: Pluginspec
PluginSpec.description:
Plugin spec for the service. *(Experimental release only.)*


> **Note**: ContainerSpec, NetworkAttachmentSpec, and PluginSpec are > mutually exclusive. PluginSpec is only used when the Runtime field > is set to `plugin`. NetworkAttachmentSpec is used when the Runtime > field is set to `attachment`.

ContainerSpec.title: Containerspec
ContainerSpec.description:
Container spec for the service.


> **Note**: ContainerSpec, NetworkAttachmentSpec, and PluginSpec are > mutually exclusive. PluginSpec is only used when the Runtime field > is set to `plugin`. NetworkAttachmentSpec is used when the Runtime > field is set to `attachment`.

NetworkAttachmentSpec.title: Networkattachmentspec
NetworkAttachmentSpec.description:
Read-only spec type for non-swarm containers attached to swarm overlay networks.


> **Note**: ContainerSpec, NetworkAttachmentSpec, and PluginSpec are > mutually exclusive. PluginSpec is only used when the Runtime field > is set to `plugin`. NetworkAttachmentSpec is used when the Runtime > field is set to `attachment`.

Resources.title: Resources
Resources.description:
Resource requirements which apply to each individual container created
as part of the service.

RestartPolicy.title: Restartpolicy
RestartPolicy.description:
Specification for the restart policy which applies to containers
created as part of this service.

ForceUpdate.title: Forceupdate
ForceUpdate.description:
A counter that triggers an update even if no relevant parameters have
been changed.

Runtime.title: Runtime
Runtime.description: Runtime is the type of runtime specified for the task executor.

Networks.title: Networks
Networks.description: Specifies which networks the service should attach to.

LogDriver.title: Logdriver
LogDriver.description:
Specifies the log driver to use for tasks created from this spec. If
not present, the default one for the swarm will be used, finally
falling back to the engine default if not specified.

SizeBytes.title: Sizebytes
SizeBytes.description: The size for the tmpfs mount in bytes.

Mode.title: Mode
Mode.description: The permission mode for the tmpfs mount in an integer.

Type1.title: Type1
Type1.description:
The mount type:

- `bind` a mount of a file or directory from the host into the container.
- `volume` a docker volume with the given `Name`.
- `tmpfs` a `tmpfs`.
- `npipe` a named pipe from the host into the container.

Parallelism.title: Parallelism
Parallelism.description:
Maximum number of tasks to be updated in one iteration (0 means
unlimited parallelism).

Delay.title: Delay
Delay.description: Amount of time between updates, in nanoseconds.

FailureAction.description:
Action to take if an updated task fails to run, or stops running
during the update.

Monitor.title: Monitor
Monitor.description:
Amount of time to monitor each updated task for failures, in
nanoseconds.

MaxFailureRatio.title: Maxfailureratio
MaxFailureRatio.description:
The fraction of tasks that may fail during an update before the
failure action is invoked, specified as a floating point number
between 0 and 1.

Order.description:
The order of operations when rolling out an updated task. Either
the old task is shut down before the new task is started, or the
new task is started before the old task is shut down.

UpdateConfig.title: UpdateConfig
UpdateConfig.description: Specification for the update strategy of the service.

NoCopy.title: Nocopy
NoCopy.description: Populate volume with data from the target.
